meanings.definition: An enzyme that destroys bacteria by breaking down their cell walls.
meanings.sent1: The lysozyme in our bodies fights off harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how lysozyme can kill bacteria to develop new medicines.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria were no match for the powerful lysozyme in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the lysozyme breaking down obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The lysozyme acted like a tiny warrior, battling the bacteria to keep the body safe.

meanings.definition: A protein found in tears, saliva, and other bodily fluids that helps protect against infections.
meanings.sent1: Tears contain lysozyme, which helps keep our eyes healthy.
meanings.sent2: The lysozyme in saliva plays a crucial role in fighting off germs.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the lysozyme in spit was the real superhero of the body.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like lysozyme, always there to protect others from harm.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained how lysozyme in bodily fluids acts as a shield against infections.
